title: Rookie of the Year
sub_head: An architect of the historic Midwest peace plan lands in Chicago.
body:
After persuading a group of university presidents to adopt reasonable Covid policy, how hard can it be for Justin Fields to play quarterback in the National Football League? An advocate for sensible risk assessment, Mr. Fields led a successful campaign to allow football to resume in the Big Ten Conference last fall. Then he spent a few months showing why he has the talent and toughness to lead a professional football team. Yet the Ohio State star somehow lasted until the 11th selection in the first round of the NFL draft on Thursday night.
Thatâ€™s when he was chosen by the Chicago Bears, who were not originally scheduled to pick 11th, but traded away four other picks for the chance to grab the accurate passer with the strong arm.
